image.altText: Man with black hair in white t-shirt and grey hoodie stands on beach with waves crashing on rocks behind him on a sunny day

props.synopsis: A former financial planner who stole $3.3 million from his clients to fund his sports betting addiction writes to the prime minister from his prison cell, urging him to adopt the recommendations made by a parliamentary inquiry into online gambling harm.

title.children: 'This has to stop': From behind bars, a former sports betting addict is urging the PM to tackle gambling addiction

image.altText: An effigy of Benjamin Netanyahu was walked through the streets around the US Capitol ahead of his address to Congress.

props.synopsis: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is met with thousands of protesters demanding his arrest during a visit to Washington, where he's pressing Congress to continue to support his war in Gaza.

title.children: Protesters pepper-sprayed, hundreds arrested in Washington as Netanyahu speaks to Congress

image.altText: An aerial shot of whales grouped together in the ocean

props.synopsis: The tiny coastal town of Cheynes Beach is still waiting for answers 12 months after one of the largest mass pilot whale standings in Australian history.

title.children: Cause of 'horrendous' stranding of almost 100 pilot whales still a mystery one year on

image.altText: CFMEU generic

props.synopsis: A senator who helped kill the building industry watchdog now says Labor needs a "stronger response" to the CFMEU scandal.

title.children: David Pocock voted to kill the CFMEU's watchdog. Now he says a 'stronger response' is needed

image.altText: A woman sits in a lounge room and stares into the camera.

props.synopsis: ASIC has launched an investigation into cold callers offering superannuation reviews. Those impacted say they felt pressured to switch superannuation providers.

title.children: 'You're not just selling a box of chocolates': Cold callers offering super reviews under investigation

image.altText: A close up shot of a child smiling

props.synopsis: The family of a toddler who died at a Perth hospital say they will consider taking legal action if their son's death isn't investigated further.

title.children: Family of toddler who died in hospital vow to 'fight to the end' for fresh probe into death

image.altText: Nadene Dodd arrives at Perth Central Law Courts on a wet day, wearing a black LA Lakers jumper, with a man beside her.

props.synopsis: The former boss of WA's Department of Justice says the death of an Aboriginal teenager in youth detention was preventable and apologises to his mother for the failure. WARNING: This story discusses incidents of self-harm and contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: 'I failed you': Former WA corrections boss apologises to mother of 16yo who died in custody

image.altText: The view out a window towards an old mine.

props.synopsis: Pyramiden was abandoned after the fall of the Soviet Union, but plans for its revival are adding to growing tensions with NATO in the Arctic.

title.children: An Arctic ghost town is stirring back to life. What is Russia up to?

image.altText: A composite image of Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: The two sides of politics in Australia will slug it out over inflation, immigration and energy between now and the election — and both will be closely watching how these issues play out in the US.

title.children: Albanese and Dutton are watching three potent issues bubbling away in the US

image.altText: An aerial shot of the inner-city Perth suburb of Mount Hawthorn

props.synopsis: Australian housing prices continue to "defy expectations", rising for a sixth-straight quarter.

title.children: Australian property prices remain resilient despite economic headwinds

image.altText: A modern hotel room with a blue blanket on bed.

props.synopsis: More than one-third of adults in Australia are not getting the recommended amount of sleep per night. Now, the over-tired are the target of the multi-billion-dollar "sleep tourism" industry, which promises a good night's sleep — for a fee.

title.children: Sleep tourism is a multi-billion-dollar industry, and Australian hotels are jumping on the bandwagon

image.altText: Joe Biden waves as he stands in front of a US presidential seal. He has a slight grimace as he looks into sun.

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden prepares to detail his reasons for pulling out of the 2024 US presidential election in a prime-time Oval Office address, scheduled to begin shortly.

title.children: Biden to give Oval Office address about his exit from election race

image.altText: An aerial view shows houses and units in the West Bank, with dirt roads leading between

props.synopsis: Seven Israeli settlers involved in violent attacks on Palestinians and illegal settlement activity in the West Bank are hit with financial sanctions and travel bans.

title.children: Australia imposes sanctions on seven Israeli settlers in West Bank

image.altText: Wind turbines

props.synopsis: Big business urges Tanya Plibersek to avoid the temptation of a quick deal with the Greens over its proposed nature reforms, and instead work with the Coalition in reducing regulation of environment projects.

title.children: Proposed nature laws could stall wind and solar projects, business council warns

image.altText: Eddie Ockenden and Jess Fox with the Australian flag.

props.synopsis: Jess Fox and Eddie Ockenden will have the honour of carrying the Australian flag at Saturday morning's opening ceremony on the Seine.

title.children: Fox, Ockenden named Australia's flag-bearers for Paris Olympics opening ceremony

image.altText: Rugby 7s

props.synopsis: Australia secures gutsy wins over Samoa and Kenya to get the Olympics off to the perfect start for the men's rugby sevens team.

title.children: Men's rugby sevens team gets Australia off to the perfect Olympics start with quarterfinals secured

image.altText: Fans are grabbed by security

props.synopsis: Argentina coach Javier Mascherano decried "the biggest circus I have ever seen in my life" after a pitch invasion takes the gloss off Morocco's 2-1 Olympic football victory.

title.children: 'The biggest circus I have ever seen': Crowd trouble mars Morocco's Olympics victory over Argentina

image.altText: A Jack Russell dog in a kennel.

props.synopsis: A 47-year-old WA woman has been jailed for 15 months for an "incredibly disturbing" attack on a Jack Russell, which was later put down.

title.children: 'No remorse at all': Woman jailed after brutally bashing small dog

image.altText: A shipwreck at the bottom of the ocean.

props.synopsis: Researchers have solved a maritime mystery spanning more than half a century, finally bringing closure to those left behind.

title.children: After more than half a century, one of Australia's biggest maritime mysteries has been solved

image.altText: A composite photo of Kaylee McKeown Shayna Jack and Mollie O'Callaghan

props.synopsis: Australia's swimming team has been a veritable medal factory in recent Olympic Games and the expectation in Paris is no different. Here are the Aussie swimmers to watch.

title.children: From Titmus to McKeown — these are the Aussie swimmers carrying our golden hopes in Paris

image.altText: A man performing a stunt with a mountain bike mid-air

props.synopsis: Australian BMX champion Logan Martin says he has had a "crazy start" to his Olympics trip, after his team's van was broken into on a Belgian street.

title.children: Australian cycling star has gear stolen day ahead of Olympics

image.altText: A man sits behind an Australian flag

props.synopsis: It's been three years since Tony Gustavsson's last tilt at an Olympic medal. So what have he and his team learned from the last time they tried?

title.children: 'We've done it before': Can the Matildas' matured mentality create Olympic history?

image.altText: Woman crouched next to a fluffy brown puppy in a quiet neighbourhood.

props.synopsis: When Mary purchased a labradoodle in Tasmania, she didn't expect to feel like she was rescuing him. She also didn't expect the health conditions that would follow.

title.children: Labradoodle from shut down breeder had issues from start, with owners spending more than $200,000 in vet bills

image.altText: Rugby players leap for a lineout

props.synopsis: As the Paris Olympic Games gets underway, high hopes have been pinned on its rugby 7s team. A century ago there were similar hopes for the French 15-a-side team, but they were stunned by an unexpected rival.

title.children: Rugby was an early staple at the Olympic Games, until a group of 'street fighters and saloon brawlers' stunned the French

image.altText: Passengers wait at Madrid airport while a screen shows the blue screen of death.

props.synopsis: The world's worst tech outage shocked many and exposed the underlying fragility of our networks, but for cybersecurity specialists it's merely a taste of things to come.

title.children: The CrowdStrike outage took many by surprise, but there have been warning signs for years

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The ASX is expected to fall when it opens this morning, following US markets which saw their worst losses since late 2022. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set to open lower following US markets

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX set to fall following US lead

image.altText: A man covers a woman's face with water

props.synopsis: Hoards of Aussies are trading scarves for singlets and going north of the equator where deadly heatwaves are in full force. But it takes time to adapt to extreme heat so preparing before you go is essential.

title.children: We all want the overseas trip of a lifetime but pushing through the heat is killing tourists

image.altText: A woman in a wheelchair sits at a table before her meal

props.synopsis: Dysphagia is common among aged care residents and can often lead to dehydration and malnutrition but many don't know it's warning signs. Here is what to look for.

title.children: More than a million Australians have dysphagia. Do you know what it is?

image.altText: Woman stands next to a for sale sign with a house super-imposed

props.synopsis: Would you live in a tiny home? What about a caravan on a farm stay? Here are the ways some Australians are getting a foot on the property ladder.

title.children: Tiny homes, relocatables, caravans: This is how Aussies are getting creative when it comes to buying a home

image.altText: A biblical painting of Jesus Christ in which various characters have been replaces with cartoon characters

props.synopsis: His recent painting may have caused offence to some of Sydney's Christian community, but Philjames explains how his artistic process is one of care and a deep fascination with iconography.

title.children: Meet Philjames, the man whose 'Looney Tunes Jesus' was the centre of an art prize controversy

image.altText: three men in army greens standing by an army vehicle

props.synopsis: Around 400 Australian Defence Force personnel have taken part in Operation Austral Shield, simulating an attack on the region by a theoretical enemy.

title.children: Troops on the ground for exercise in northern WA as calls grow for permanent military presence

image.altText: Matildas celebrate

props.synopsis: The Matildas are in for a tough group at the Olympics, facing off against some of the world's strongest teams. Here's a guide to who they're playing and when.

title.children: What you need to know about the Matildas' Olympic run

image.altText: A close-up of Prince Harry who wears a suit and has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Speaking for the first time since his four-year legal battle with Mirror Group Newspapers, the royal has discussed the impact of the case in a new documentary.

title.children: Prince Harry says legal battles with tabloid press were a 'central piece' to relationship breakdown with royal family

image.altText: A bright graphic of a US flag, with pictures of two young girls, a boy, and a ballot box superimposed over it.

props.synopsis: If Donald Trump is returned to power in November's presidential election, for better or worse, the US is in for a big shake-up — one that could be felt for generations in Australia.

title.children: How a Trump victory could affect young Australians for years to come
